result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra A. Kercher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $100 fine plus costs
*No DNA Surcharge
*Bond monies to be applied to the fine/costs after restitution has been paid

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra A. Kercher

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Debra A. Kercher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:33 p.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Mukoski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification; no victim appears in Court to day and no victim impact statement had been provided.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
No DNA Surcharge
Pay restitution in the amount of $535
Bond monies to be applied to the restitution first and then the fine/costs
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

8/14/2018 Bond is amended from $500 cash to $1,500 cash. 
$500 has been previously posted.  An additional $1,000 to be posted prior to her release.

Defendant Debra A. Kercher appeared by video. Attorney Katena Roberts-Turner in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:23 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court reviews the file.  The defendant failed to appear at a plea hearing in Branch 2. 
Court questions Atty Roberts-Turner re: withdrawal of prior public defender.  

Court asks counsel to see Branch 2 for another plea/sentencing date. 

State requests a $1,500 additional cash increase in the bond. 
Atty Roberts-Turner makes bond arguments to the Court.   Asks to have a signature bond set due to the defendant's limited resources. 
Court questions Atty Roberts-Turner re: defendant's attire.

Pre-trial conference on October 30, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:35 p.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.
Atty Zell states that he spoke with Atty McFarland and that the defendant is at a funeral.
Atty Zell would request a bench warrant with a cash alternative of $200.
Court questions Atty McFarland as to where is client is; Atty McFarland responds.
Court will not issue a warrant at this time but will reschedule the plea/sentencing.
Atty Zell indicates that they will need to speak with JA to get a date.
Atty Zell states they have a plea agreement at this time but that may change. 

BY THE COURT:
